Posts.Content: Did u have salt baths? How's your skin since RT?  Do u think high factor and avoiding sun is permanent choice now or just for couple months past ? Sorry more questions - I trust asking here muchore than any Google site!
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Kate Good luck for tomorrow; had my apt Monday and start RT with you on 1st - with you in spirit All advice fits - tattoos nip a little but a deep breath and you get three new freckles.  Ask staff all your questions, I was nervous too, back into the unknown but nurses are great, ask all your questions and you'll feel more prepared and ready for 1st. Glowing in the dark would be the best perk eh?! x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Did someone say  'last zap!! Happy celebrating Leigh :)))
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: HI Sailingangel Well done on getting to the halfway mark, doing great.  I read you enjoy and still have baths. I get real achey joints and love deep, hot side of warm, Epsom salt baths but I start RT in a couple of weeks and fully expected to have to wait until it's all finished to have baths.  Any advise or thoughts welcome!
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: That's reassuringly brilliant to hear! Thank you :))) x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: @Runner58 Oh me too - I am relieved to hear that I can at least try to have my baths when I want, they really are a relaxing treat - it's the little things sometime isn't it?! This site has been a godsend for information and reassurance.  Thanks everyone for sharing.  Wishing you well with your treatment x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: I really recommend Epsom salt baths for aches I find them a real treat. Not sure how they suit RT but as u find baths no.probs I'm going to try with salts too :))  Thanks for all your advice Here's hoping treatments continue to go well and quickly x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Kate! Nice that we are in sync (that sounds weird that anything much about all this could be nice - but you know what I mean )  Odd that you didn't get FISH results.  Neither do I get how you could be expected to pay for any treatment.  Has anyone else on the site heard this?  I don't mean to concern you, I'm as in the dark as you and it really seems that everyone has different treatment.  perhaps you can ask here or check on the Macmillan helpline, for peace of mind. I'm not surprised all this had you feel teary, it's enough to get your head around without these uncertainties.  I had a really low weekend last week and I think it's important to roll with it.  It's harder for you with a little one, I hope you find time to purely put yourself first.  I do know you are doing great, that you have endless support here and I hope this past weekend helped - we've had bright blue skies, freezing but lovely and sunny with it As for blue tatts - you had to be different eh?!    I don't know about you but I still have a blue, going green, nipple from my opp.  Hoping it will eventually return to 'normal'! Will be thinking of you this week, especially Thursday.  We got this X
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ February 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Sorry wished u happy celebrationso before reading u won't celebrate quite yet!  Maybe a little on  the inside for crossing such a milestone?  However it goes, Well done you
